name: Palazzo Magnani Feroni

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: My mom and I stayed here for 3 days about a week about. We are spoiled and hard to please but we liked it! I really enjoyed the old time elevator which had a little sofa in it. The whole place had a nice ambiance. Our two room suite had beautiful ceilings and was nicely decorated. The location was perfect for me. It was on the other side of the Arno from the duomo and the major tourist attractions which enables guests with cars to get there without too much trouble but its only a 5-10 minute walk from everything. It's also nice, at the end of the day, to be away from the hustle bustle. I liked that guests had to be buzzed in. As women traveling alone, little things like this make us really happy and at ease. The breakfast was lovely. It's not just pastries. They'll make you an omelette if all that bread scares your thighs. Service was friendly and attentive. Whenever we had questions- they were kindly answered. Some high end hotels are skilled at making guests feel unwanted but the reception and staff were very warm here- another huge plus in my opinion. I really loved this place. My mom called it the mini piti palace which I think was fitting. They had nice bathroom products - Bvlgari (my fav!)- which smells amazing but considering we were two chicks with tons of hair we could have used some more conditioner. Thankfully we pack our own. While on the topic of hair I must mention our hairbrush was accidentally taken by the staff. I don't know if it was used in a voodoo ritual or was found in the dumpster but after asking the front desk about it (oddest question ever asked. Did you steal our hairbrush by accident or are we crazy??) it was returned. This led to many jokes throughout our trip and was a source of amusement. What happened? We don't really want to know. :) another oddity is the bathroom. In Beatrice, the bathroom doors were glass and as my mom was watching TV she could see me in shower. I'm sure she's seen enough of my buns for one lifetime. Maybe a curtain or frosting the glass would be beneficial? My only genuine gripe is the cost of parking. 50€/night is a tad scandalous. For the price paid, perhaps they could cap it at a much more reasonable 25€. I'm sure I'll be back in Florence soon and I would pick to stay here again. It was a nice and easy experience. Sure the place has a few minor faults but overall it's amazing. I got to stay in a palace in Florence for a few nights. I think that's magical. :)
reviews.title: An escape from Florence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our third stay at the Palazzo, just as much as the first two. Have already booked another stay for this coming April. Service is impeccable, the location can't be beat, wonderful breakfast. You won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Third stay - great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in October for 3 nights. Huge lounge and separate bedroom and bathroom. Lovely traditional building. Coffee and snacks everywhere for guests. Nice, helpful staff. Only disappoitment was that the terrace was closed. highly recommend. 10 mins walk from Dumo. 5 mins from Ponte Vechio.
reviews.title: Excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my husband stayed here for 2 nights on our honeymoon.
reviews.title: Perfect Hooneymoon Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to choose the “smallest” suite the junior suite which is where all of the walls are painted.
reviews.title: Lived up to the highest of expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our sixth visit to the Palazzo. Great location - minutes from the antique venues, views across the River and city - magical when sipping champagne on the top terrace. Florence is one of my favorite cities and Palazzo Magnani Feroni is one of my favorite hotels in the world... The staff lovely, efficient and always helpful with organising tours, tea, breakfast, snack, champagne,,,,
reviews.title: 6th Visit, Wonderful, Romantic get a way plus great place for business stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You must taste the wine and champagne available in the hotel - Diadema - amazing bottle design plus great tasting. Red, White, Champagne -
reviews.title: Fulfilling a Dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are suites - beautifully organised and have great charm ... you should try all the suites... In the suites you find special selected soaps, personallised booklets on Florence listing restaurants, shopping destinations, Art Exhibits, Musems, etc. , special CD's - Great Hotel
reviews.title: Unique, beautiful accomodation and fabulous staff. Magnificent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Retunring Oct 2009 for a few days ....
reviews.title: Huba Huba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I started our honeymoon here and we couldn't have asked for anything better. Before we arrived, the staff had arranged dinner reservations, sight-seeing tours and transportation. We also shipped our luggage to the hotel ahead of time and they helped get it out of Italian customs and it was waiting for us when we arrived.
reviews.title: Don't bother booking anywhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Health warning: this will spoil you for all other hotels in Florence.
reviews.title: a unique experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location is perfect for sightseeing and exploring on foot the small cobbled streets of Oltrarno with its plethora of small shops and restaurants, as well as palazzo Pitti and the Boboli Gardens, the Ponte Vecchio area, the Duomo and all the other museums in the historical centre. The hotel can help with booking tickets ahead so you avoid the queues - but this can also be done online.
reviews.title: Fabulous time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The building itself, in the owner's family for over 250 years, was sympathically restored and opened in 2002 as a suites only hotel retaining many original architectural features but without sacrificing any comfort. For example the vaulted ceilings are dizzyingly high but the rooms are warm in winter.
reviews.title: charming and beautiful palazzo in the heart of Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The suites are all enormous and elegantly furnished but so comfortably you instantly feel at home, with amenities such as TVs and DVD players, minibar, a safe, Bulgari toiletries, a free guide and map to Florence and lots of information in the folder given on arrival. A word of caution: the bottled of wine enticingly placed on a side table and labeled "for your tasting enjoyment" actually costs EUR44, although the charge only becomes apparent upon checkout.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has many lounging areas, a billiard room, a magnificent breakfast room decorated with antique family portraits. The roof terrace offers spendid views of Florence.
reviews.title: The best experience ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We now visit here every year - fantastic surroundings, very efficient staff who show a real interest in everyone staying. Close to city centre (15 minute walk) yet a respite from the hustle-bustle. The suites are terrific - we have stayed in a different one each year (now our 6th year in Florence). The breakfast room has a stunning chandelier and great service. This was our first "winter visit" so our first experience of the bar not being on the roof terrace - though it is still possible to go there to see the wonderful views - still very relaxing.
reviews.title: Once again - magnificent!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside - having to leave!
reviews.title: this was one of our all time favorite places to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great palace,better location, huge rooms, excellent staff always willing to help
reviews.title: Over the top - the best ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: roof top deck is a big bonus. really good breakfast
reviews.title: Truly unique historic building, elegant suites very helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an all suites hotel. Huge rooms, well appointed baths, the staff is ever attentive to your needs. The hotel exceeded my expectations in every area it is no wonder that the are continually winning awards.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for our honeymoon and had a wonderful week. The suite we had was the smerelda and it was amazing. The staff were polite and always on hand to help, the breakfasts were very good quality and the cocktails were spot on. I would reccomend this to anyone. The hotel is on the quieter side of the river but is only a short walk to the main attractions, there are some nice bars and restaurants in this arty side of the city.
reviews.title: As good as the reviews
Magnificent
reviews.text: My only constructive feedback would be about the bathroom in the suite. For a room of its size and cost we were hoping for a more luxurious bathroom, the shower was small and the drainage was poor but I am being picky here as the accomodation is first rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights and wished it was longer. The room was spacious and extremely comfortable, the junior suite makes you feel you are staying in an old palace. Breakfast was spectacular and the choice almost unlimited. The location is great as you are just outside of all the crowds. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: The Best,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our daughter sent a year in Florence , however we did not know this hotel then. First of all we have stayed at the Lungarno, many times and Villa Massa....but ths hotel surpasses them all. We loved the location , easy to walk everywhere. It is in an area up and coming...perfectly safe! All suites, our 2 rooms and bath were sumptuous. Breakfasts were served either in the room or a breakfast room.A huge selection of food, all fresh and delicious . The staff was terrific. It was just simply wonderful. Priced well, service great location superb.....what more could you ask for. We cannot wait to go back next year.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay in a beautiful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked Palazzo Magnani Feroni for my partner's birthday and it more than lived up to our expectations. Florence is historic, beautiful and spellbinding, and the Magnani Feroni fits perfectly into this backdrop. It is tucked away in a quiet backstreet on Oltrano. The main sights of Florence are a short walk away and there are any number of traditional shops and restaurants on its doorstep. Staff could not have been more attentive and the service was first rate. Lorenzo the Magnificent would have felt at home. I would recommend the Palazzo to anyone looking for an unforgettable stay in this most beautiful of cities.
reviews.title: Very magical stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Four of us stayed in a two bedroom suite at this wonderful hotel for just 24 hours due to a tight schedule. Therefore, in advance, I requested that the hotel arrange three things for us: a lunch reservation, a dinner reservation, and an afternoon walking tour of the old historic center including a guided tour of the Uffizi Museum with an english speaking guide. All was arranged and confirmed in advance. It was a delightful experience to live in this palace with it's large suites, beautiful hallways, and other public spaces. The hotel is within walking distance of the train station and the historic center of town. The breakfast was sumptuous - we regretted that our schedule rushed us out. Service was excellent. Rooms were very quiet.
reviews.title: Palazzo Magnani Feroni for 24 hours

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have visited Florence every year for several years now. The last several years we have had the privilege of staying at the Palazzo Magnani Feroni. This is a stunning, quiet hotel on the "other side of the Arno." Over the years we have enjoyed both Suite Dionora as well as Suite Beatrice...magnificent. The staff now welcomes us back as if we are family. The attention to detail is beyond compare and seemingly executed with the greatest of ease. We cannot imagine a more perfect start to a day in Florence than with breakfast in the stunning breakfast room. The panoramic view of Florence from the terrace is not to be missed. When we travel to Florence, there is only one place to stay and that is at the magnificent Palazzo Magnani Feroni. In this hectic, modern day, it is rare indeed to find a place that consistently and repeatedly exceeds expectations. Grazie mille to our dear friends at the Palazzo Magnani Feroni!! Cheri and Tom Kelley
reviews.title: A Privilege Savored

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in a great suite. Excellent free breakfast. Great bathroom products, and custom soap. Could use new mattresses, and a blind or curtain on the bathroom door. Nice staff. Parking expensive, but told of price in advance. Perfect ambiance for Florence.
reviews.title: Like a Mini Pitti Palace, Great Place to stay in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited in November for two nights and found the Palazzo Magnani Feroni to be excellent in terms of location, facilities and quality of service. The breakfast was superb with a very wide choice of delicious food - no lunch needed! The history of the house is interesting; it has been owned by the current family for over 200 years and has been well preserved so that you do feel that you are indeed staying in an old palace, but with 21st century comforts.
reviews.title: A superb place to stay in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well we were very lucky with this hotel and got a fantastic deal price wise so for us it was great value for money. The hotel is very renaissance - frescoes on the walls of our bedroom. The lift was amazing - the third oldest in Florence we were told - and the roof terrace was great if cold but that's November for you. There are however only 12 rooms so it didn't feel like it had much life and i felt like whispering every time i went through the lobby. In terms of the room it was large with large and comfortable bed and a sofa and chair. The TV etc were great, very modern and all fine. I would have been disappointed with the bathroom if we had paid more, the shower was small and flooded all the time. The location is great and I am so pleased we went the other side of the arno - it is a different and much better world. you are 10 mins from the Uffizi 15 mins from the station, 5 mins from the ponte vecchi
reviews.title: lovely hotel but quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a wonderful three night stay at this elegant hotel situated right in the heart of Florence so convenient for all the sights. The staff were both courteous and friendly. Our suite was very comfortable but it suffered a little from traffic noise. Although the breakfast was good we did feel that cooked alternatives should have been included at no extra cost.
reviews.title: Superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, if we returned to Florence we would have no hesitation in returning to the Palazzo Magnani Feroni.
reviews.title: Sheer elegance in a museum-like setting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had the privilege of staying at the Palzazzo Magnani Feroni for the week of October 5, 2009. The Palazzo and its staff exceeded every expectation. I had made arrangements prior to our arrival for sunflowers and Prosecco to be delivered to our suite. Both were there to welcome us upon our arrival. The staff quietly, efficiently and expertly attends to every detail and request. Our stay could not have been more restful or perfect. We have stayed in Florence on many occasions but this was our first stay at the Palazzo...we have found a new home in Florence. The Palazzo surpasses every hotel experience we have had in Florence both in terms of the beauty of the hotel and the professionalism of the staff. You should not miss the elegance and charm of Palazzo Magnani Feroni!!!
reviews.title: fantastic service, great setting, would do it again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second stop on our honeymoon. The staff greeted us at the door, had upgraged us to a larger suite, (with a balcony large enough for us to sit on and have our morning coffee), and we can not say enough about the staff. They were excellent!! Daniel (at the front desk), and Manual (at the rooftop bar) anticipated our every need. To tell the truth all of the staff was great. Room service was the fastest we have EVER had.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast spread was great, the rooftop bar had a wonderful view, the bathroom was large with every amenity, our suite was large and comfortable, and you felt like royalty, staying in a former palazzo. I highly recommend for anyone looking for something different. You felt special every time you stepped into the hotel.
reviews.title: Couldn't Get Away From There Fast Enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were extremely pleased with the elegant and spacious rooms and facilities. The staff was amazingly friendly, helpful, and professional. The rooftop terrace had wonderful views and was a elegant and romantic way to unwind in the evening and enjoy a few drinks before or after (and maybe before and after) dinner. Great location within walking distance of main tourist areas. It was by far the best place we stayed while in Venice, Florence, Capri, and Rome. We had a wonderful three nights there and kept wishing we were back at the Palazzo for the rest of the trip. We highly recommend to everyone and would definitely stay there again when in Florence.
reviews.title: Truely exceptional Palazzo and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel is lovely. Wonderful roof terrace with views of Florence. Especially good for families with children (we included a nine and 16 year old). Well located: everything is a relatively short walk away. Be sure to check out Santo Spiritu in Oltrarno for the dinner scene.
reviews.title: Perfect for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a three night trip to Florence and stayed at the Palazzo Magnani Feroni hotel. All i can say is that if you are going to stay in Florence this the place to stay. The hotel is stunning inside. The service is impeccable and the staff are fantastic. The suites have to be seen to be fully appreciated.
reviews.title: A true palace.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in 'Diletta' suite which had a living room which was the size of a modern two bedroomed house. It was fully equipped with two tv's, sky tv and DVD player, mini bar, safe, luxury Bulgari products.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The roof top terrace bar is fantastic and overlooks the whole of Florence.
reviews.title: Finally, the perfect solution for visiting family and friends!

likes.disliked: — perhaps a bit pricey for some pockets

description: Located in an outstanding location at the heart of the bustling, medieval neighbourhood of San Frediano, a mere 5-minute walk from the Ponte Vecchio and the city’s finest shopping district, the Palace offers only suites, Feroni, Deluxe, Executive, Junior and Classic suites.They are spread over four floors of the Palace, encompassing a gallery that is filled with objects of art and decorated with a style that brings back the past. A personal and discreet service is provided to the guests day and night.
